intro: Bletia urbana, commonly known as the urban orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features a rhizomatous stem with fleshy leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Bletia urbana is characterized by its unique floral structure, with three sepals and three petals, and a lip that is often marked with distinctive patterns. It plays an important role in its ecosystem by supporting pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
